detsymm_test.cpp

Calculates the determinate of the symmetric matrix "amatA". Calculates the determinate of matrix amatA by using its n eigenvalues that first will be calculated. The determinate is then given as:

Parameters:
amatA  matrix, which is symmetric, so only the bottom triangular matrix must contain values. At the end of the function amatA always contains the full matrix.
vmatA  matrix, that will contain the scaled eigenvectors at the end of the function.
dvecA n-dimensional vector that will contain the eigenvalues at the end of the function.
Returns:
The determinate of matrix amatA.
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the eception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that amatA is not a square matrix
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1998
Changes
2003/10/02 by S. Wiegand due to name change of 'eigensymm';
Status
stable
00001 //===========================================================================
00050 //===========================================================================
00051 #include <iostream>
00052 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00053 #include "LinAlg/linalg.h"
00054 
00055 using namespace std;
00056 
00057 
00058 int main() 
00059 {
00060     Array2D< double > A(3,3);    // input matrix
00061     Array2D< double > x(3,3);    // matrix for eigenvectors
00062     Array  < double > lambda(3); // vector for eigenvalues
00063     unsigned          curr_row,  // currently considered matrix
00064                       curr_col;  // row/column
00065     double            det(0.);   // determinate of input matrix
00066 
00067     // Initialization values for input matrix:
00068     double bottom_triangle[9] = 
00069     { 
00070          7.,  0.,  0., 
00071 
00072         -2.,  6.,  0., 
00073 
00074          0., -2.,  0. 
00075     };
00076 
00077     // Initializing matrices and vector:
00078     for (curr_row = 0; curr_row < 3; curr_row++)
00079     {
00080         for (curr_col = 0; curr_col < 3; curr_col++)
00081         {
00082                 A(curr_row, curr_col) = bottom_triangle[curr_row*3+curr_col];
00083                 x(curr_row, curr_col) = 0.;
00084         }
00085             lambda(curr_row) = 0.;
00086     }
00087 
00088     // Output of input matrix:
00089     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00090     writeArray(A, cout);
00091 
00092     // Calculating the determinate, eigenvectors and eigenvalues of the matrix:
00093     det = detsymm(A, x, lambda);
00094 
00095     // Output of determinate:
00096     cout << "the determinate of the matrix is " << det << endl << endl;
00097 
00098     // Output of eigenvector matrix and eigenvalue vector:
00099     cout << "matrix of eigenvectors:" << endl;
00100     writeArray(x, cout);
00101     cout << "vector of eigenvalues:" << endl;
00102     writeArray(lambda, cout);
00103 
00104     return 0;
00105 }
